User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

I did: Tried loading up my website in Firefox. Sometimes it loads [ rarely ] and most of the time it doesn't. I just get an error.

I saw: "400 Bad Request
It is not a valid request! Powered By LiteSpeed Web Server
Lite Speed Technologies is not responsible for administration and contents of this web site!"

I expected: To see my website, I have no problems in IE.


Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Cleaned cookies cache.
2. Used other browsers to make sure it's truly not the site's servers but it wasn't. This issue only happens in Firefox.
3.

Actual Results:  
It still happens on and off. I have no issues with IE. Which is looking better and better to use due to all these issues Firefox 4 is giving me.

Expected Results:  
I expected to see my website. But all I get more than not is some stupid error request. It's leading people to believe my site is down. I've lost thousands of of people visiting my site, traffic is down by A LOT.
comments.creator: asilee.com@hotmail.com

I've been seeing odd issues lately as well with network connections:

Though I have tried setting network.http.connection-retry-timeout;0 didn't help much, but then I have changed:
network.http.max-connections;60
network.http.max-connections-per-server;5

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110428 Firefox/6.0a1 ID:20110428030557

I did get it connect better after I changed all these settings in about:config
comments.creator: mozbugz@outlook.com
